Authors:
Ranjani Somayji, Tarah Lynch, James N Powell, Daniel
Gregson
Title:
Remote Transient Lactobacillus animalis bacteremia causing
prosthetic hip joint infection: A case report.
Abstract:
Lactobacillus spp.are an uncommon pathogen in
immunocompetent hosts. A case of chronic hip prosthetic joint infection
(PJI) caused by L. animalis occurring 5 years after a transient
bacteremia is described. Whole genome sequencing of both isolates proved
this PJI infection resulted from remote bacteremia.
